results.title: The Emily Rodda video
results.creator_credit: Insight Profile, Christine McCaul Gleitzman and Mark Waters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Emily Rodda became a writer by accident. One night, she made up a story for her daughter about a young girl and her experiences throughout the day. Her daughter asked her to repeat the story the following night. Using everyday examples, Emily explains that anyone can be a writer. She shares her thoughts on how to develop small ideas based on simple objects, people and situations - into large ones, and then how to extend on these ideas to create a novel, using what she calls, the simple spell. The simple spell is just two words: What if?

results.title: The Emerging eskimo
results.creator_credit: Brayton-Kendall Productions and Centron Educational Films
results.brief_description: Documentary film showing the effect of colonisation on the Eskimo socio-culture. Since the first arrival of the Europeans, the selling potential of Alaskan resources was quickly realised. This caused devastating damage to ecological aspects vital to Eskimo survival. In addition tho this, the film shows how colonial influence has caused ruptures in Eskimo tradition and religion.

results.title: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
results.creator_credit: BBC, UNICEF, London Film Productions, Channel 0-28 and David Bowen-Jones
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Global report”.
This compilation tape consists of two programs. 1. “Emergency situation in Africa” illustrates the related problems of farming, malnutrition, disease and rural-urban migration in Africa. (22 mins.) 2. “Valley of hope” shows some of the benefits of having a health care worker in a developing country by comparing infant survival in two villages in Colombia; one which has a health care worker and one which doesn’t (30 mins.) “Valley of hope” is also available as an individual title.

results.title: The Emerald forest
results.creator_credit: Embassy Pictures Corporation (US) and John Boorman
results.brief_description: Based on a true story of American engineer Bill Markham (Powers Boothe), whose son is kidnapped while working in Brazil. His son is kidnapped by a tribe called “The Invisible people”, due to their ability to camouflage. Despite the authorities giving up the search, Markham and a French photographer continue the search, until the photographer is killed and the father must go on alone. Cast also includes Meg Foster, Charley Boorman and Rui Polonah. Made in the Amazon rainforest and written by Rospo Pallenberg.

results.title: The Emancipation of women: 1890-1930
results.brief_description: Compilation of archival film showing early campaigns for women’s rights, and the rights and freedoms won by the end of the 1920’s. This film captures the Suffragette movement in its campaign to earn the vote. The historical advisor for this film was Arthur Marwick, Professor of History, The Open University.

results.title: The Elysian bus
results.brief_description: Five people discover each other in an unknown place in a heavy fog. Through flashbacks the situation is gradually clarified: each has been involved in a fatal car accident, due, in all cases, to carelessness.

results.title: The Eleven Powers
results.creator_credit: Cinetel Productions, Larry Gartenstein and Frank Heimans
results.brief_description: In 1979, the Festival of the Eleven Powers took place on the island of Bali. The festival is called into being every 100 years to mark the closing of the Balinese century and re-establish the balance of the positive and negative forces in the world. Over two million people took part in the sixty days of purification and religious fervour. Script by Bryce Courtenay and narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: The Elephant will never forget
results.brief_description: Trams in London are a thing of the past - buses have taken over. The film, completed in London’s “Last Tram Week”, takes you round the streets of South London and along the embankment with 2 cockneys who remember a song about trams that they sang in the music halls fifty years ago. Finally, 20,000 Londoners cheer and sing their goodbyes to the trams which for 91 years have rattled and clanged and swayed by.

results.title: The Elephant man [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Brooksfilms, Jonathan Sanger and David Lynch
results.brief_description: Deformed at birth by a rare disease, penniless John Merrick is forced to become the star attraction in a travelling freak-show. Treves, a compassionate surgeon, rescues him from the fairground taunts, coaxing out of the terrified, disabled man a touchingly unembittered personality. This multi-award winning film stars Anthony Hopkins, John Hurt, John Gielgud and Anne Bancroft. Based on “The Elephant man and other reminiscences” by Sir Frederick Treves and in part on “The Elephant man: a study in human dignity” by Ashley Montagu. Cast includes John Hurt, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller

results.title: The Elephant
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Jiminy Cricket tells the history of the evolution of the elephant, from prehistoric mastodons and mammoths; describes the elephant of today and how it uses its trunk; and shows how the Indian mahout trains his elephant to work.
